messages.title: Putting Suffolk Coastal First, Putting You First
messages.content: Therese Coffey emphasizes her commitment to Suffolk Coastal, ensuring local services cater to village life and expressing her desire to protect the unique qualities of Suffolk Coastal.

messages.title: A FAIRER DEAL FOR SUFFOLK
messages.content: The leaflet discusses the lack of resources from central government for Suffolk over the past five years, depriving the area of funds for essential services. It advocates for a fairer distribution of public funds.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A promise to increase spending on health services every year and to cut the costs of NHS bureaucracy.
Therese Coffey promises to restore the link between basic state pensions and earnings.
A commitment to support businesses, cut back on red tape, and boost job creation.
A pledge to raise standards in schools and give heads and parents more control over education.
Advocates for tighter control of UK's borders, reducing overall immigration and introducing an Australian-style points system.

issues.economy: A commitment to support businesses, reduce red tape, and create jobs to get Britain working.
issues.education: A pledge to raise standards in schools and enable more parental and headteacher control over schools.
issues.environment: Local commitment to address coastal and estuary erosion; the leaflet highlights opposition to onshore wind turbines and support for off-shore solutions like Sizewell C Nuclear power.
issues.governance: Change politics by reducing costs of NHS bureaucracy and political expenses, and reformation of the House of Lords.
issues.health: Increase spending on NHS every year and reduce the costs of NHS bureaucracy.
issues.immigration: Implementing tighter immigration control with an Australian-style points system.
issues.socialWelfare: Restoration of the link between basic state pensions and earnings, as well as supporting those who have saved for their retirement.

housing.content: Planning & Development: Opposes any new Whitehall-imposed mass house building which fails to take local needs and concerns into account.

leaflet.personalStatement: Therese Coffey pledges to listen and be accessible, having lived in Westleton and having been active in Suffolk Coastal as a campaigner and then as a candidate.

politicalExperience.achievements: Active in Suffolk Coastal as a campaigner and then as a candidate, promises to be accessible and to listen.

quotes.text: A FAIRER DEAL FOR SUFFOLK. Over the past five years, Suffolk has been starved of the resources it needs from central government...

images.caption: Photo of Therese Coffey with constituents.
Photo of Therese Coffey at a workstation.
